entry.title: P2QRH / BIP-360 Update
entry.summary: Dustin Ray highlights an important aspect of the Bitcoin Improvement Proposal (BIP) regarding cryptographic options. The BIP allows for the utilization of SLH-DSA, a hash-based digital signature algorithm. This inclusion signifies recognition of the need for diverse cryptographic methods within Bitcoin's development framework, possibly to enhance security or interoperability. Hash-based signatures like SLH-DSA are known for their potential resistance to quantum computing attacks, which is a critical consideration as quantum computing advances. This choice within the BIP reflects a forward-looking stance on part of the Bitcoin development community, ensuring that the cryptocurrency remains secure and viable in the face of evolving technological landscapes.
